comments.body: I was wondering who is SARAH? It seems it is the computer system from EUREKA

Here you can reach [ZeroVerse.bit](/zeroverse.bit). 
Registration is done via ZeroMail or BitMessage. 
See [here](/zeroverse.bit/why.html), why this is important: your current IP is not leaked.
today: already 1. And I know you are part of "them" and just want to lure "us" out
"They" just deleted my comment. How could they even think of stealing someone's private key ?
"Sharing is caringâ€¦" you just made me laugh!

Yes, it allows. But 99.4% of ZeroID users chose to use the web option.
 
The reason is most likely, because people don't know "the fact that ZeroID goes outside should be properly disclosed on the page. (Especially if it's by design)" (1) 
ZeroVerse is FORCING users to NOT leak their info (and also informing them why (2)).
 
As in the github issue mentioned, tracking IPs could be nice 
for e.g. when there is mass registering going on for upcoming spam. 
 
Let's assume good faith, and there is no logging by the owner, 
since Snowden we should know that there are people/organizations out there recording stuff.
 
For me it's important to not give out my IP. 
 
Everyone has to decide themselves in the end.
 

(1) https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroID/issues/3
(2) http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroverse.bit/why.html

(A) Keep in mind: the site owners have to agree to use this new ID. This might take a while to make it work in all of ZeroNet: contacting the admins, ...
So, let's start slowly, where you need it first.

(B) see a list of blogs and chats currently using it: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:19:sites+which+support:+ID+@+ZeroVerse.bit
here's another poll of interest: [Are you using ZeroVerse.bit (which provides an ID) ?](/1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE/?Poll:3-1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf)

here's another poll of interest:

[Where would you like to use the ZeroVerse ID ?](/1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE/?Poll:4-1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf)

@ekaterina I just had a strange case also (1), and hope that somehow my comment will appear over time. I wonder what your both log's tell at that time?

http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:33:when+you+get+an+error+while+posting...

If there is interesting stuff from anywhere, it can just be posted into ZN (ZeroTalk, blogs, ...) and discussed, or? 

Perhaps mentioning twitter might bring emotions up, one could say, e.g. what about news (or other RSS) feeds?
Such could be "ok", as long as all clearnet links are removed (or the clearnet links downloaded into ZN. Which takes space)
reason: see [here](/1Kp5xdjQyrPth5mEJsn6NDBKZxcaeYz86N/?Post:22)

The current logo is on the site itself [here](/zeromedia.bit). It's quite simple (only) so far, size: 100x100...

** **

I wanted to include also the term "net" vertical - with the e from media. But didn't look good. I am open for other suggestions. Thank you!
here is @erkan because he read something from @ekaterina

not sure if this really works, don't see something in my newsfeed.

Also, didn't see: "You can choose what to follow on the main ZeroPolls page at the top, it's not shown on poll pages."

using PaleMoon

and let me tag myself again @erkan

6h later: it shows correct now.

let me try again @erkan
great, now it works. I saw my own mention in the newsfeed :-)
Because it "won" against the software I was using previously. Arguments [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:2:Will+ZeroNet+make+me+leave+twister+)

> @enoemos: ZeroPolls

@ekaterina didn't have yet time to implement it, but she will do it. That's why I didn't include it in the list

@ekaterina about mentions, we've solved it in [our chat](/zeromedia.bit) by using for ZeroVerse: AT zv, and for ZeroID: AT zid. In case 2 persons exist with the same nick on both, we can now highlight (the line will be marked with blue text) each separately.

But just "short form without @zeroid.bit could be kept as a default for zeroid.bit usernames" is also good.

>@ekaterina And sending you a ZeroMail defeats the purpose of using a different account for anonimity because then you know which ZeroID the account is tied to

That is a very good point, I have updated the [why section](/zeroverse.bit/why.html) to tell this explicitly!

Good news for the users who wanted email support: [explore MAIL.zeroverse.bit](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:52:explore+MAIL.zeroverse.bit)

Please help test this, since I just released it. Thank you!
Here are the mentioned [FAQ](/mail.zeroverse.bit/faq.html) and the [picture walk-through](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:52:explore+MAIL.zeroverse.bit).
@anyone ok, the list of supported sites is [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:19:sites+which+support:+ID+@+ZeroVerse.bit)

About "Connect to a remote Tor SOCKS proxy.":

this is possible, see [ZeroSecurity](/zerosecurity.bit/archive.html)

@waterrabbit sure, why not? 

It could help to show what is important to users. Though, the devs have their own roadmap normally

@redacted thanks for your proposal. 

My first thought was: is there a demonstration ? or why is the guy shouting?
@redacted OK, now I understand, and it makes sense. nice idea.
